solution_line_template: Matthew rode {distance_to_first_sign} feet to the first sign, so there are {total_ride_distance}-{distance_to_first_sign} =<<{total_ride_distance}-{distance_to_first_sign}={distance_after_first_sign}>>{distance_after_first_sign} feet between the first sign and the end.

After passing the second sign Matthew road {distance_after_second_sign}, so {distance_after_first_sign}-{distance_after_second_sign} = <<{distance_after_first_sign}-{distance_after_second_sign}={distance_between_signs}>>{distance_between_signs} feet remain.
